string.name: text
string.value: #eHekatonian Calendar Year 52#n

string.name: text
string.value: #eAngel of Death#n\nAny story worth telling has an unexpected start.

string.name: text
string.value: We lost many lives the day the Anti-Magic Stone fell, and its destruction gave us our first glimpse of her new form.

string.name: text
string.value: She took on a spectral appearance as her body reformed before our very eyes. A sinister light surrounded her in a halo of darkness!

string.name: text
string.value: Terror overtook us, and many proclaimed this sight was an#r omen of disaster#k.

string.name: text
string.value: Years later, our worst fears became reality.

string.name: text
string.value: #eHekatonian Calendar Year 54#n

string.name: text
string.value: #eOrphan's Empathy#n\nI've not heard the name #rJean#k in quite some time. The last words that boy ever spoke to me still echo within my mind.

string.name: text
string.value: \n"If I had died in that accident... would anyone have missed me?"

string.name: text
string.value: As an orphan with no home or family, it seems his greatest fear was of being forgotten.

string.name: text
string.value: Perhaps his own circumstances sparked compassion for the girl within him.

string.name: text
string.value: But I could never be sure, and time has clouded my memory of him.

string.name: text
string.value: #eHekatonian Calendar Year 54#n

string.name: text
string.value: #eHekaton the Benevolent#n

string.name: text
string.value: That is how the people of Kritias saw their king. His strength, wisdom, and compassion surpassed even his extraordinary knowledge of magic. Under his brilliant leadership, Kritias entered into its grand renaissance.

string.name: text
string.value: But as the city flourished, the king became weak and frail with age. His once great mind became warped by fear, and his benevolence turned to cruelty.

string.name: text
string.value: Even the advanced magical knowledge of Kritias could not stop his aging.

string.name: text
string.value: \nYears later... the king I met in the dungeon was no longer the king of old.

string.name: text
string.value: \nHis lust for immortality had turned him into a monster consumed by hate and greed.

string.name: text
string.value: #eHekatonian Calendar Year 54#n

string.name: text
string.value: #eDire Repercussions#n\nThe most terrifying part of that dungeon wasn't the shadows cast by the flickering torches.

string.name: text
string.value: It was the sounds echoing through its halls... the low, guttural moans, the endless pounding on the thick iron door. Enduring the constant sound of despair and agony issuing from beneath our feet was enough to drive anyone mad.

string.name: text
string.value: After exhaustive research, I finally discovered the shocking truth behind it.

string.name: text
string.value: We had been conducting experiments to see if we could transfer the girl's power of immortality to another test subject. But the recipient's body always rejected the magic. Every one of our attempts failed, and each time they did, the recipient vanished.

string.name: text
string.value: We thought nothing of it until the day a researcher went downstairs to retrieve supplies and discovered the horrifying byproducts of our work.

string.name: text
string.value: It was only then that I realized... The test subjects' bodies may have been destroyed, but their souls... their souls remained. What we found in the dungeon were their vain attempts to reform bodies they could never again inhabit.

string.name: text
string.value: The horror of what we had done was sickening. We had no choice but to seal the dungeon and turn a deaf ear to the tormented souls hidden below.

string.name: text
string.value: But Hekaton was relentless... bordering on inhuman... and the experiments continued for years. How many lives did we doom to an eternity of suffering?

string.name: text
string.value: #eKritias - Anthology of Retrospection#n

string.value: #eHekatonian Calendar Year 54#n

string.name: text
string.value: #eDire Repercussions#n\nThe most terrifying part of that dungeon wasn't the shadows cast by the flickering torches.

string.name: text
string.value: It was the sounds echoing through its halls... the low, guttural moans, the endless pounding on the thick iron door. Enduring the constant sound of despair and agony issuing from beneath our feet was enough to drive anyone mad.

string.name: text
string.value: After exhaustive research, I finally discovered the shocking truth behind it.

string.name: text
string.value: We had been conducting experiments to see if we could transfer the girl's power of immortality to another test subject. But the recipient's body always rejected the magic. Every one of our attempts failed, and each time they did, the recipient vanished.

string.name: text
string.value: We thought nothing of it until the day a researcher went downstairs to retrieve supplies and discovered the horrifying byproducts of our work.

string.name: text
string.value: It was only then that I realized... The test subjects' bodies may have been destroyed, but their souls... their souls remained. What we found in the dungeon were their vain attempts to reform bodies they could never again inhabit.

string.name: text

string.name: text
string.value: But Hekaton was relentless... bordering on inhuman... and the experiments continued for years. How many lives did we doom to an eternity of suffering?

string.name: text
string.value: #eHekatonian Calendar Year 54#n

string.name: text
string.value: #eShattered Kingdom#n\nWhen I finally came to my senses, it was far too late. The whole of Kritias was nearly obliterated in the aftermath of Hekaton's failed ritual. What's more, the resultant time disruption was forcing the doomed kingdom into the future.

string.name: text
string.value: It was then that the Black Mage discovered Tana's existence and invaded Kritias. A burst of magic that intense could never have gone unnoticed.

string.name: text
string.value: Ironically, Hekaton regained his humanity only as the failed experiment began to destroy his body. He spent his final moments evacuating the people of Trueffet.

string.name: text
string.value: The memory of those lost will forever haunt me.

string.name: text
string.value: #eKritias - Anthology of Retrospection#n

string.name: text
string.value: #eHekatonian Calendar Year 54#n

string.name: text
string.value: #eAtonement#n\nSo many lives ended with Kritias's demise. How could I remain a priest after being party to such heinous acts?

string.name: text
string.value: So I exiled myself...

string.name: text
string.value: I intend to spend what remains of my life atoning. I know it is impossible, and I will forever be consumed with sorrow, but it is the only fate I deserve.
